name: melodeon
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a small accordion (= a musical instrument consisting of a folded central part with a small keyboard on the end, played by pushing the two ends towards each other), used especially for playing folk music: He was still regularly playing the melodeon with his band, the Hooleys, until six months before his death.
karammiri/iStock/Getty Images Plus/GettyImages
a small organ that makes musical notes when metal reeds (= thin pieces) are made to vibrate by air that is sucked in: Only the week before he had found her seated at the little old melodeon, playing and singing a duet with her sister. See also
harmonium
Jupiterimages/PHOTOS.com>>/Getty Images Plus/Getty Images /GettyImages
